abstracts.cdata!:
With more than half of its two million
            inhabitants living in unplanned squatter settlements, the
            Venezuelan capital of Caracas is faced with immense
            challenge in delivering basic services to its people.
            Responding to the governments request for assistance, the
            World Bank has initiated a 60.7 million dollars Caracas
            urban upgrading project, which is among the largest World
            Bank-financed programs aimed at providing integrated, basic
            urban services to slum-dwellers. The project has improved
            the living conditions of approximately 250,000 residents
            living in the large slum settlements of Petare Norte and La
            Vega in metropolitan Caracas.
